title: NASA Sends Astronauts Back to the Moon
summary: NASA is planning to send astronauts around the Moon again for the first time in over 50 years. This is part of a big space adventure called the Artemis program. NASA has been busy with many missions, like launching science satellites and testing new airplanes. They are working hard to explore space and make new discoveries. The agency has support from the government to do these exciting things. NASA wants to show that America is a leader in space. They hope to land astronauts on the Moon by 2028 and maybe even go to Mars one day. This is all about learning more about our universe and inspiring people.

keywords.explanation: the space agency of the United States
a NASA program to explore the Moon
going to new places to learn about them

options: That the Moon is made of cheese

questions.question: By what year does NASA hope to land astronauts on the Moon?
What might NASA explore after the Moon?

background_read: NASA is the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, a U.S. government agency that explores space. They send rockets, satellites, and astronauts to learn about planets, stars, and more. The Artemis program is their new plan to go back to the Moon, similar to the old Apollo missions. Space exploration helps us understand our world and can lead to new technologies.
Article_Structure: WHAT: Sending astronauts around the Moon and exploring space
WHERE: Around the Moon and in space
WHY: To show American leadership and make new discoveries

perspectives.description: NASA is excited to lead space exploration and inspire people with new missions.
